background: The goal of the CTUIR Biomonitoring program is to assess the effectiveness of CTUIR sponsored habitat restoration actions on spring Chinook salmon (Oncorhynchus tshawystscha), summer steelhead (Oncorhynchus mykiss), and bull trout (Salvenlinus confluenctus) populations. Monitoring of the biological and geo-fluvial responses to habitat restoration actions is fundamental to informing future management actions. CTUIR performs snorkel and electrofishing surveys that are consistent with BPAs AEM programmatic protocol (https://www.monitoringresources.org/Document/Protocol/Details/2030) to measure site level responses to stream habitat restoration efforts.
title: Estimating Juvenile Salmonid Abundance for CTUIR Biological Monitoring of Fish Habitat Action Effectiveness
assumptions: Access to impact and suitable control reaches will be provided prior to project implementation and for a period of 10 years following project completion.
objectives: Measure presence and relative abundance of fish species and life stages by habitat type and season
